top_categories.workout_context: Salida 76 rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Salida 76 when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Salida 76’s colorado rockies, mountain gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Salida 76. Make this intensity feel like home.
Racing Salida 76 isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Salida 76’s 6,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Salida 76’s colorado rockies gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Salida 76’s colorado rockies gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Every session at Salida 76 intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Salida 76 — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Salida 76 — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Salida 76’s 6,000ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Salida 76’s 76 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Salida 76. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Salida 76 requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on colorado rockies gravel to build confidence. Expect: colorado rockies, mountain gravel, high altitude.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Over Under, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 76 miles of colorado rockies gravel in Salida, CO.
